com.google.appinventor.buildserver

Class PathUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appinventor.buildserver.PathUtil

  • public class PathUtil
extends Object
    Constants and utility methods related to storage. Based largely on com.google.appinventor.shared.storage.StorageUtil
    Author:
    markf@google.com (Herbert Czymontek)

    • Method Detail

      • basename

        public static String basename(String path)
        Gets the final component from a path. This assumes that path components are separated by forward slashes.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to apply the basename operation to.
        Returns:
        path, with any leading directory elements removed

      • dirname

        public static String dirname(String path)

        Determines the parent directory of the given path. This is similar to dirname(1). This assumes that path components are separated by forward slashes.

        The returned path omits the last slash and trailing component; for example, "/foo/bar.txt" becomes "/foo". There are a special cases:

        • If the last slash is the first character in the input, the return value is "/".
        • If there are no slashes in the input, "." is returned.

        Parameters:
        path - the path to strip
        Returns:
        the parent path, as described above

      • trimOffExtension

        public static String trimOffExtension(String path)
        Returns a copy of the given path with the extension omitted.
        Parameters:
        path - the path
        Returns:
        path, with the extension elements omitted.

      • getPackageName

        public static String getPackageName(String qualifiedName)
        Returns the package name part of an dot-qualified class name.
        Parameters:
        qualifiedName - qualified class name
        Returns:
        package name

      • getContentTypeForFilePath

        public static String getContentTypeForFilePath(String filePath)
        Returns the content type for the given filePath.

      • isTextFile
